workouts.description: Complete rest for recovery and muscle repair.
Warm-up (10 min easy), then 6-8 x 600m repeats at targeted pace with equal recovery (jog/walk). Cool-down (10 min easy). Focus on form and maintaining consistent pace.
Maintain a conversational pace, ensuring heart rate stays low (Zone 2). Prioritize recovery. This pace should feel very comfortable.
Warm-up (10 min easy), then 25-30 minutes at a comfortably hard pace. Cool-down (10 min easy). Focus on sustained effort and controlled breathing.
Light activity like cycling, swimming, or walking to promote blood flow and active recovery. Alternatively, complete rest if feeling fatigued.
Slow, steady pace for endurance building. Focus on consistency and enjoy the run. Hydrate well before, during, and after.
Complete rest for recovery and mental recharge.
Complete rest for recovery and muscle repair.
Warm-up (10 min easy), then 5 x 800m repeats at targeted pace with 400m easy jog recovery. Cool-down (10 min easy). Focus on maintaining strong pace as you get tired.
Strictly easy pace, focus on low heart rate. This run is for recovery and should feel effortless.
Easy pace, perhaps include 4-6 x 100m strides at the end to improve leg turnover (not factored into total distance/pace). Keep strides relaxed.
Light activity like cycling, swimming, or walking to promote blood flow and active recovery. Alternatively, complete rest if feeling fatigued.
Long, steady effort to build endurance. Focus on consistent easy pace and consider your nutrition/hydration strategy.
Complete rest for recovery and mental recharge.
Complete rest for recovery and muscle repair.
Warm-up (10 min easy), then 30-35 minutes at a comfortably hard, sustained pace. Cool-down (10 min easy). This is a key endurance builder, focus on strong, even effort.
Strictly easy pace, focus on low heart rate. Crucial for recovery after your tempo run.
Warm-up (10 min easy), then 4 x 1000m repeats at a strong, controlled pace with 400m easy jog recovery. Cool-down (10 min easy). Focus on hitting consistent splits.
Light activity like cycling, swimming, or walking to promote blood flow and active recovery. Alternatively, complete rest if feeling fatigued.
Your longest run of the plan. Focus on consistent easy effort and proper fueling/hydration. Listen to your body and adjust if needed.
Complete rest for recovery and mental recharge.
Complete rest for recovery and muscle repair. This mini-taper week is crucial for absorbing training.
Warm-up (10 min easy), then 6 x 400m repeats at a slightly faster pace with 200m easy jog recovery. Focus on leg speed and feeling quick. Cool-down (10 min easy).
Short, very easy recovery run. Keep it super relaxed and focus on low heart rate. It's OK to go slower than usual.
Warm-up (10 min easy), then 20 minutes at tempo pace. Cool-down (10 min easy). Maintain sharpness without overdoing it as you enter the taper phase.
Light activity like cycling, swimming, or walking to promote blood flow and active recovery. Alternatively, complete rest if feeling fatigued.
Reduced long run to allow for recovery while maintaining endurance. Keep the pace easy and enjoy the lighter load.
Complete rest for recovery and mental recharge.
Complete rest for final recovery before a potential performance day later in the week.
Warm-up (10 min easy), then 5-6 x 150m strides at near race pace with long recovery. Cool-down (10 min easy). Focus on feeling fast, light, and relaxed.
Very short, very easy run to shake out legs. Aim for pure relaxation and low effort.
Warm-up (10 min easy), then 10 minutes at a comfortably strong pace, then cool-down (10 min easy). Just to remind your legs of speed and race rhythm.
Minimal activity or a very short, easy walk to stay loose. Final rest day before potential race. Hydrate and fuel well.
Optional very short, easy shakeout run (3km) to feel fresh for Sunday. Keep it incredibly light and relaxed. If feeling tired, opt for complete rest.

**Option 1: 5K or 10K Race/Time Trial.** Put your training to the test! Focus on a strong, even effort and listen to your body. **Option 2: Active Recovery or Rest.** If no race, enjoy a light activity or full rest. The main training block is complete, celebrate your progress!
